t: Joel 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
The Land Laid Waste
Hear*pn this, you elders, And*ld give ear, all you inhabitants of the land! Has*ld anything*i like*i this happened in your days, Or*ld even in the days of your fathers?
Tell*ld your children about it, Let*ild your children tell*i their children, And*ld their children another generation.
What*ld the chewing locust left, the swarming locust has eaten; What*ld the swarming locust left, the crawling locust has eaten; And*ld what the crawling locust left, the consuming locust has eaten.
Awake,*ln you drunkards, and weep; And*ld wail, all you drinkers of wine, Because*ld of the new wine, For*ld it has been cut off from your mouth.
For*ld a nation has come up against My land, Strong,*ld and without number; His*ld teeth are*i the teeth of a lion, And*ld he has the fangs of a fierce lion.
He*ld has laid waste My vine, And*ld ruined My fig tree; He*ld has stripped it bare and thrown it*i away; Its*ld branches are made white.
Lament*ln like a virgin girded with sackcloth For*ld the husband of her youth.
The*ld grain offering and the drink offering Have*ld been cut off from the house of the Lord;*s The*ld priests mourn, who minister to the Lord.*s
The*ld field is wasted, The*ld land mourns; For*ld the grain is ruined, The*ld new wine is dried up, The*ld oil fails.
Be*ln ashamed, you farmers, Wail,*ld you vinedressers, For*ld the wheat and the barley; Because*ld the harvest of the field has perished.

The*ld vine has dried up, And*ld the fig tree has withered; The*ld pomegranate tree, The*ld palm tree also, And*ld the apple treeâ€” All*ld the trees of the field are withered; Surely*ld joy has withered away from the sons of men.
Mourning for the Land

Gird*pn yourselves and lament, you priests; Wail,*ld you who minister before the altar; Come,*ld lie all night in sackcloth, You*ld who minister to my God; For*ld the grain offering and the drink offering Are*ld withheld from the house of your God.
Consecrate*ld a fast, Call*ld a sacred assembly; Gather*ld the elders And*ild all the inhabitants of the land Into*ild the house of the Lord*s your God, And*ld cry out to the Lord.*s
Alas*ln for the day! For*ld the day of the Lord*s is*i at hand; It*ld shall come as destruction from the Almighty.
Is*ld not the food cut off before our eyes, Joy*ld and gladness from the house of our God?
The*ld seed shrivels under the clods, Storehouses*ld are in shambles; Barns*ld are broken down, For*ld the grain has withered.
How*ld the animals groan! The*ld herds of cattle are restless, Because*ld they have no pasture; Even*ld the flocks of sheep suffer punishment.
O*ln Lord,*s to You I cry out; For*ld fire has devoured the open pastures, And*ld a flame has burned all the trees of the field.
The*ld beasts of the field also cry out to You, For*ld the water brooks are dried up, And*ld fire has devoured the open pastures.
